dimensions: plate (sheet trimmed to plate): 15 × 10 cm (5 7/8 × 3 15/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: Collector stamp  in purple ink, verso lower left: F. Schindler Lugt 2351)
inscribed:
Signed and dated in plate, upper right corner: HGoltzius Inuent / JMatham sculp. / Ao 1597.

Numbered, lower left corner: 1

Two lines of Latin in margin: Sacra fides passim, ... firmo faedere gentes.  C. Schon[a]eus

makers.displaymaker: after Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Friedrich Schindler [?-ca. 1913, Lugt 2351]; sale of the collections of Rudolf Peltzer, Grégoire Stroganoff, and Friedrich Schindler, Stuttgart, May 2, 1913, lot 849; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
